title: Hearing the shape of an arena with spectral swarm robotics
abstract: arXiv:2403.17147v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Swarm robotics promises adaptability to unknown situations and robustness against failures. However, it still struggles with global tasks that require understanding the broader context in which the robots operate, such as identifying the shape of the arena in which the robots are embedded. Biological swarms, such as shoals of fish, flocks of birds, and colonies of insects, routinely solve global geometrical problems through the diffusion of local cues. This paradigm can be explicitly described by mathematical models that could be directly computed and exploited by a robotic swarm. Diffusion over a domain is mathematically encapsulated by the Laplacian, a linear operator that measures the local curvature of a function. Crucially the geometry of a domain can generally be reconstructed from the eigenspectrum of its Laplacian. translated_title: 用频谱群体机器人听到一个竞技场的形状
translated_abstract: Swarm机器人技术承诺适应未知情况，并且对于故障具有鲁棒性。然而，它仍然在需要理解机器人操作的更广泛背景的全局任务中遇到困难，比如识别机器人嵌入的竞技场的形状。生物群体，比如鱼群、鸟群和昆虫群，通过局部提示的扩散例行解决全局几何问题。这一范式可以通过数学模型明确描述，可以通过机器人群体直接计算和利用。域上的扩散在数学上由拉普拉斯算子进行封装，该算子用于度量函数的局部曲率。关键是，一个区域的几何形状通常可以从其拉普拉斯算子的特征谱中重建。在这里，我们介绍了频谱群体机器人技术，其中机器人将信息扩散给他们的邻居来模拟拉普拉
tldr: 频谱群体机器人可以通过模拟信息扩散来重建竞技场的几何形状
en_tdlr: Spectral swarm robotics can reconstruct the geometry of an arena by simulating information diffusion.
